block_keys.description: Remove all keys that match a regular expression. If `matchCase` is set, the match will be case sensitive.

matchCase.description: Flag which controls if the regex match will be case-sensitive

regex.description: Regular expression that will be used match blocked keys

block_keys.label: Block keys

allow_keys.description: Remove all keys that don't match a regular expression. If `matchCase` is set, the match will be case sensitive.

matchCase.description: Flag which controls if the regex match will be case-sensitive

regex.description: Regular expression that will be used match allowed keys

allow_keys.label: Allow keys

aggregate.description: Aggregate records in a time window(specified in seconds), grouping by a set of keys and computing new keys on aggregated data.
aggregate.label: Aggregate records

keys.description: Keys which will be used for grouping

compute.description: Additional keys which will be computed for each group

flatten.description: Flatten a submap in the key `key` by extracting all keys/values and setting into the parent object, then deleting `key`. If `regex` is set, only keys that match will be transferred. If `keepOrig` is set, then the submap is not deleted.
flatten.label: Flatten subrecord

keepOrig.description: If true, the flattened object will not be removed from the record.

regex.description: Regular expression that will be used match keys that will be merged

key.description: Key which contains the nested object to be merged.

copy.description: Copy key `src` to `dst`. If `regexMode` is set, `src` is treated as a regular expression and `dst` as a substitution pattern. All keys that keys that match the regex will be copied to new keys defined by the substitution pattern, which can reference captures in the regex.

dst.description: Destination key to which the value will be copied to. If `regexMode` is true, this can reference captured groups.

src.description: Source key from which the value will be copied from. If `regexMode` is true, this can match multiple keys.

regexMode.description: If set, `src` will be treated as a regex and `dst` as a substitution pattern.

copy.label: Copy keys

replace.description: Use `regex` to do a global search/replace in the key specified by `key`. The `replacement` option can be used to specify a substitution pattern (which can reference captures). The `submax` option can be used to specify the maximum number of substitions done.
replace.label: Search/replace value

key.description: Key which contains value to be replaced.

regex.description: Pattern within the value which will be replaced.

replacement.description: Replacement pattern. Can reference capture groups in the `regex`.

matchCase.description: Flag which controls if the regex match will be case-sensitive

csv_encode.description: Encode object in the key `src` as CSV into the key `dst`. If `header` is set, then it will be used to extract keys/values from `src`, and the generated CSV stream will have the header. If not, then `src` must be an array of strings.
csv_encode.label: Encode CSV

dst.description: Destination key which will receive the serialized CSV.

src.description: Source key which contains the object to be converted to CSV. If `header` is not set, this must be an array of strings.

header.description: Preset header for the generated CSV stream

hash.description: Compute hash of a `src`. By default the result will go into a key in the format "[SOURCE_KEY]_[HASH_ALGORITHM]", but it can be overriden by setting `dst`.
hash.label: Hash key

dst.description: Destination key which will contain the computed hash. Defaults to "[SOURCE_KEY]_[HASH_ALGORITHM]".

src.description: Source key from which will be used to compute the hash

csv_decode.description: Decode CSV data in the key `src` into key `dst`. If `parseHeader` option is set, the first row of parsed CSV is treated as the header, and subsequent rows will be parsed as key/value pairs. If not, the data will be parsed as array of values.
csv_decode.label: Decode CSV

dst.description: Destination key which will receive the parsed object.

src.description: Source key which contains raw CSV data.

extract_kv.description: Use regular expression to extract key/value pairs from the text in `src`. The regex must have two captures, which will be set as the key and value. The result is a map/object, which will be set to the key `dst`.

dst.description: Destination key which will contain the parsed object

src.description: Source key from which keys/values will be extracted from.

regex.description: Regular expression that will be used to extract keys/values. It must have two capture groups, which will be the key and value.

extract_kv.label: Extract keys/values

rename.description: Move key `src` to `dst`. If `regexMode` is set, `src` is treated as a regular expression and `dst` as a substitution pattern. All keys that keys that match the regex will be moved to new keys defined by the substitution pattern, which can reference captures in the regex.

dst.description: Destination key to which the value will be moved to. If `regexMode` is true, this can reference captured groups.

src.description: Source key from which the value will be moved from. If `regexMode` is true, this can match multiple keys.

matchCase.description: Flag which controls if the regex match will be case-sensitive

regexMode.description: If set, `src` will be treated as a regex and `dst` as a substitution pattern.

rename.label: Rename keys

redact.description: Hide a pattern specified by `regex` in the `key` by replacing it with a certain characted such as "*"(default).
redact.label: Redact/mask value

matchCase.description: Flag which controls if the regex match will be case-sensitive

regex.description: Pattern within the value which will be redacted.

key.description: Key which contains value to be redacted.

replaceChar.description: Characters which will replace the value.

allow_records.description: Drop all record that have a key not matching a regular expression. If `matchCase` is set, the match will be case sensitive.

regex.description: Regular expression that will be used match the key

matchCase.description: Flag which controls if the regex match will be case-sensitive

allow_records.label: Allow records

put.description: Set `key` to `value`. If the key already exists, it will be override.
put.label: Set key/value

parse_number.description: Parse numeric text in the key `key`. If `regex` is set, the pattern used to extract number text can be customized.

regex.description: Regular expression used to extract number from the value.

key.description: Key from which a number will be extracted.

parse_number.label: Parse number

json_decode.description: Decode JSON data in the key `src` into key `dst`.

dst.description: Destination key which will receive the parsed object.

src.description: Source key which contains raw JSON data.

json_decode.label: Decode JSON

block_records.description: Drop all record that have a key matching a regular expression. If `matchCase` is set, the match will be case sensitive.

regex.description: Regular expression that will be used match the key

matchCase.description: Flag which controls if the regex match will be case-sensitive

block_records.label: Block records

json_encode.description: Encode the object in the key `src` as JSON into the key `dst`.

dst.description: Destination key which will receive the serialized JSON.

src.description: Source key which contains the object to be converted to JSON. If missing, the whole record will be serialized.

json_encode.label: Encode JSON

custom_script.description: Inject a Lua script in the processing rule pipeline. The script must return a function that has the same interface as the one implemented by fluent-bit Lua filters.
custom_script.label: Custom Lua

script.description: Lua script implemented similarly to fluent-bit Lua filters.
script.default:
-- The function below has an API similar to that of fluent-bit Lua scripts.
-- The main exception is the extra paramenter `code`, which contains the value
-- returned by the previous processing rule.
--
-- See https://docs.fluentbit.io/manual/pipeline/filters/lua for details.
return function(tag, ts, record, code)
  -- Add statements before the "return" line.
  -- You can access a certain field ("field_a" for example) in
  -- using "record.field_a" or "record['field_a']".
  --
  -- Here's a simple example that concatenates "key_one" and "key_two" to
  -- a new field named "key_three"
  --
  --    record.key_three = tostring(record.key_one) .. tostring(record.key_two)
  return code, ts, record
end
